channel.title: [look] sword of the unforgiven [look]
channel.description:
First of all, look me in the eye and tell me thats not a bad-ass name. :|
Okay so i know i got a problem with handles/hilts. If you criticise the handle, give me a suggestion about it. Dont just say it sucks please
[IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/24e4ymo.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/zml342.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/2woal4n.jpg[/img] ^^if only it worked in-game

item.title: [look] sword of the unforgiven [look]
item.dc:creator: @T33J4Y T33J4Y
item.description:
@T33J4Y wrote:

Wow, that’s pretty nice. I haven’t been on the forums in weeks and you’ve already improved quite a bit. I wish I could make something like this but I haven’t been modeling for a while either, although I think I’ll start up again.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 01, 2009, 11:08:43 pm[/size][hr]Holy crap! I just realized that I’ve seen this sword before. I was actually going to try to model it a while back.
http://fc01.deviantart.com/fs9/f/2006/342/1/d/Anima__new_swords_set_1_by_Wen_M.jpg
I did model the one on the far right and the blade was perfect but the handle turned out crap.

Read full topic

item.title: [look] sword of the unforgiven [look]
item.dc:creator: @jjones10 jjones10
item.description:
@jjones10 wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:7, topic:286109”]alright, heres what i have to say (dw i decided to cut you some slack):

  1. handle is a little short and pretty thin.
  2. The handle-blade connection doesnt look right.
  3. is that supposed to be a wood handle? change it, or make it noticeably wood.
  4. try fixing the hilt. its too obviously traced. i can see ripples in the hilt from the “create” tool.
  5. The blade seems pretty thick(not wide) to be a sword, unless for a two-handed
  6. why is there only a blue edge on the tip? is the rest of the sword blunt?
  7. look at the tip in the 2nd to last pic, am i the only one who see’s the jagged part towards the bottom of the pic?

i think ill stop there. Half that stuff i cant blame on you, like the ripples. Metasequoia is choppy and has a horrible trace function. the “Create” tool is terrible for getting what you want.
Tip: Double check that there arent multiple verticies in one spot and that the edges line up properly as i can see a few areas where they dont.
Dont take this as being an ass. im simply trying to mould you into a great modeller. if i go too easy on you, i cant help you.[/quote]

Here is what i got to say

  1. i spent 18 seconds on the handle, i’ll try harder next time
  2. Its just a primitive stuck into the end of a blade, so i’ll give you that one.
  3. yeah you can see the wood texture if you look real close
  4. what hilt…? and the ripples are a part of the texture i used. its not a mistake. if you wanna see the model without ripply texture i can post a picture
  5. I guess i can make it a 2h sword that would look loads better actually
  6. the blue edge on the tip is just an added decoration, its as sharp as the rest of te blade.
  7. Yeah i didn’t notice that. I’ll fix that too

The ripples arn’t meta’s fault. They are mine. its a texture. I’ll take off if it makes it look better. The create tool isnt as bad as you say it is mr. primitive

I’ll make a v2 and fix all the things you said. give me a few minutes [br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 29, 2009, 03:53:52 pm[/size][hr][quote=“CoonHunter, post:2, topic:286109”]0.0 , mind revealing how u got that nice twist into the handle?[/quote]
The twist tool. play around with it and it can actually do wonders. Obviously i didnt do much with it here but it is actually a pretty amazing tool if you do a lot of primitive designs

Read full topic

item.title: [look] sword of the unforgiven [look]
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

alright, heres what i have to say (dw i decided to cut you some slack):

  1. handle is a little short and pretty thin.
  2. The handle-blade connection doesnt look right.
  3. is that supposed to be a wood handle? change it, or make it noticeably wood.
  4. try fixing the hilt. its too obviously traced. i can see ripples in the hilt from the “create” tool.
  5. The blade seems pretty thick(not wide) to be a sword, unless for a two-handed
  6. why is there only a blue edge on the tip? is the rest of the sword blunt?
  7. look at the tip in the 2nd to last pic, am i the only one who see’s the jagged part towards the bottom of the pic?

i think ill stop there. Half that stuff i cant blame on you, like the ripples. Metasequoia is choppy and has a horrible trace function. the “Create” tool is terrible for getting what you want.
Tip: Double check that there arent multiple verticies in one spot and that the edges line up properly as i can see a few areas where they dont.
Dont take this as being an ass. im simply trying to mould you into a great modeller. if i go too easy on you, i cant help you.

Read full topic
